newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Sept 3.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post page one - Sept 3.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on its front page on September 3:
WASHINGTON - The Clinton Administration consulted with allies about a military strike against Iraq and U.S. officials said an attack by U.S. Navy and Air Force jets and missiles appeared imminent.

WASHINGTON - With no definitive proof yet of what downed TWA Flight 800, law enforcement authorities now believe that if a bomb or missile destroyed the aircraft a case may have to be built without physical evidence.

ST LOUIS - President Clinton and Bob Dole kicked off the last two months of the presidential campaign with the country in a significantly different mood than those that dominated the elections of 1992 and 1994.
WASHINGTON - Thousands of D.C. students return to makeshift classes, experiencing the effects of budget cuts, teacher layoffs and schools closed because of fire code violations.
GROZNY - If the Chechen war is over, now what? Rebels rejoice, but a power vacuum and tensions remain.
WASHINGTON - The debate in Congress over same-sex marriages, which is set to resume this week, is remarkable in many ways, foremost that it is taking place at all.
